critique: This document is a short executive order conferring civil service status upon an individual. It is difficult to assess its ideological tilt, immigration approach, or social inclusion aspects as it pertains to a specific individual and does not address broad policy issues. The primary area where it has an impact is in executive power, as it uses the authority of the Civil Service Act to grant a benefit without regard to normal competitive rules. It has a negligible impact on federalism, national security vs. civil liberties, and economic regulation.
